Package com.peyrona.mingle.lang.interfaces.exen

Interface IRuntime

  • public interface IRuntime
    This interface represents the ExEn public API.
    An instance of this is passed to every RunTime Command: SCRIPT, DRIVER, DEVICE and RULE.
    Author:
    Francisco Jos√© Morero Peyrona Official web site at: https://github.com/peyrona/mingle

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void add​(ICommand command)
      Adds passed ICommand to the ExEn.
      ICommand[] all​(java.lang.String... sCommandType)
      Returns all living instances for passed command name.
      IEventBus bus()
      Return the instance of IEventBus that the ExEn uses.
      IRuntime exit​(int millis)
      Gently ends ExEn execution by ending all internal processes.
      ICommand get​(java.lang.String name)
      Returns the living instance which name is equals to passed argument, or null if it does not exist.

      As names are unique in Une, it is not needed to specify the type of command (Device, Rule, Scrip or Driver).

      If an empty name or null is passed, null is returned.
      <T> T getFromConfig​(java.lang.String module, java.lang.String varName, T defValue)
      Returns the configuration file in use.
      IDevice[] getInAllGroups​(java.lang.String... group)
      Returns a collection with all devices that appear in every passed group(s) or an empty array.
      IDevice[] getInAnyGroup​(java.lang.String... group)
      Returns a collection with all devices that appear in at least one of passed group(s) or an empty array.
      IDevice[] getMembersOf​(java.lang.String... group)
      Returns a collection with all devices that appear in at least one of passed group(s) or an empty array.
      boolean isGridNode()
      Returns true if this ExEn is a node of a Grid.
      boolean isLoggable​(ILogger.Level level)
      Returns true if passed Level is loggable considering current configuration.
      boolean isNameOfGroup​(java.lang.String name)
      Returns true if passed name is the name of a group instead of the name of a device.
      IRuntime log​(ILogger.Level level, java.lang.Object message)
      A more generic logging: received Exception is logged if the LogLevel is appropriate.
      When an exception occurs in ExEn, all connected clients has to be informed.
      Where the log will is stored depends on several parameters: 'write_disk' among them.
      java.util.function.Function<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String[]> newGroupWiseFn()
      Returns a function that receives the name of a group of devices and returns an Array with all the device's names that belong to the group.

      This function is needed by IXprEval::build(...).
      ICandi.IBuilder newLanguageBuilder()
      Returns a new instance of the ICandi.IBuilder defined in config.
      IXprEval newXprEval()
      Returns a new instance of the IXprEval defined in 'config.json' file.
      boolean remove​(ICommand command)
      Removes passed ICommand from the ExEn.

        Returns true if this ExEn is a node of a Grid.
        Parameters:

      • log

        IRuntime log​(ILogger.Level level,
             java.lang.Object message)
        A more generic logging: received Exception is logged if the LogLevel is appropriate.
        When an exception occurs in ExEn, all connected clients has to be informed.
        Where the log will is stored depends on several parameters: 'write_disk' among them.
        Parameters:
        level - LogLevel
        message - What to log.
        Returns:
        Itself.

      • isLoggable

        boolean isLoggable​(ILogger.Level level)
        Returns true if passed Level is loggable considering current configuration.

        Used to save CPU (do not need to compose a long string that later will not be logged).

        Parameters:
        level -
        Returns:
        true if passed Level is loggable considering current configuration.

      • exit

        IRuntime exit​(int millis)
        Gently ends ExEn execution by ending all internal processes.
        Parameters:
        millis - Delay. 'millis' 0 or negative means immediately.
        Returns:
        Itself.

      • all

        ICommand[] all​(java.lang.String... sCommandType)
        Returns all living instances for passed command name. When null (or an empty string) is passed, all instances for all commands are returned.
        Parameters:
        sCommandType - One or more of following: null, "device", "driver", "script", "rule".
        To make code better looking, names are case-insensitive and can be in plural or singular.
        Returns:
        An array with all living instances for passed command type or an empty array if no instance matched.

      • get

        ICommand get​(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the living instance which name is equals to passed argument, or null if it does not exist.

        As names are unique in Une, it is not needed to specify the type of command (Device, Rule, Scrip or Driver).

        If an empty name or null is passed, null is returned.
        Parameters:
        name - The Command's name to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        The instance which name equals to second argument or null if it does not exist.

      • add

        void add​(ICommand command)
        Adds passed ICommand to the ExEn.

        Prior to add a new entity, all its prerequisites must be satisfied: when adding a Device, its Driver must exist; and when adding a Driver, its Script must exist.

        Note that Rules do not need any other entities. But if any of its actions (THEN clause) triggers a Script and it does not exist when the rule is satisfied, and error will happen.

        Parameters:
        command - ICommand to be removed.

      • remove

        boolean remove​(ICommand command)
        Removes passed ICommand from the ExEn.

        When an Script or Driver is removed, associated devices (and drivers when removing a Script) will be also removed; but it is not ExEn responsibility to inform about these collateral effects to the listeners.
        Therefore, applications like the Mission Control Center (Glue) have to send an ExEnComm.Request.List after removing an Script or a Driver.

        Parameters:
        command - ICommand to be removed.
        Returns:
        true when the ICommand was successfully removed; false otherwise.

      • isNameOfGroup

        boolean isNameOfGroup​(java.lang.String name)
        Returns true if passed name is the name of a group instead of the name of a device.
        Parameters:
        name - Name to check.
        Returns:
        true if passed name is the name of a group instead of the name of a device.

      • getMembersOf

        IDevice[] getMembersOf​(java.lang.String... group)
        Returns a collection with all devices that appear in at least one of passed group(s) or an empty array.
        Parameters:
        group - One or more group names to retrieve devices.
        Returns:
        A collection with all devices that appear in all passed group(s) or an empty array.

      • getInAnyGroup

        IDevice[] getInAnyGroup​(java.lang.String... group)
        Returns a collection with all devices that appear in at least one of passed group(s) or an empty array.
        Parameters:
        group - One or more group names to retrieve devices.
        Returns:
        A collection with all devices that appear in at least one of passed group(s) or an empty array.

      • getInAllGroups

        IDevice[] getInAllGroups​(java.lang.String... group)
        Returns a collection with all devices that appear in every passed group(s) or an empty array.
        Parameters:
        group - One or more group names to retrieve devices.
        Returns:
        A collection with all devices that appear in every passed group(s) or an empty array.
